news.title: One-time settlement planned to upgrade B-khata in Karnataka
news.para: The Karnataka government is considering a one-time settlement scheme to upgrade B-khata properties in unauthorized layouts to A-khata, announced Minister BS Suresha amid opposition criticism of the E-khata initiative. BJP and JD(S) members criticized the E-khata scheme, calling it an 'enforcement khata' that harasses citizens.

news.title: Amazon leases six lakh sq ft warehousing at Kolkata's Oswal Logistics Park
news.para: Amazon is expanding its Indian supply chain with a 600,000 sq ft built-to-suit facility at Oswal Logistics Park in Kolkata, expected by 2027-2028. This move, part of a larger leasing spree including 800,000 sq ft in Delhi NCR, highlights Amazon's bullish outlook on India's consumption growth and its strategy to enhance last-mile delivery capabilities.

news.title: Smartworks Coworking Spaces posts ₹4.19 crore loss in Q1 FY26
news.para: Smartworks Coworking Spaces Ltd reported a reduced net loss of Rs 4.19 crore for the first quarter of FY26, a significant improvement from the Rs 23 crore loss in the same period last year. The company's total income increased to Rs 387.98 crore, up from Rs 323.15 crore in the previous year.

news.title: Lucknow: Work begins on Naimish Nagar model township along Sitapur Road
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority has initiated the Naimish Nagar scheme, a large-scale housing project spanning 1,084 hectares along Sitapur Road, aiming to accommodate approximately three lakh residents. Construction of the first site office has commenced, with land acquisition proceeding through consent-based agreements with farmers across 18 identified villages.

news.title: Etonhurst Capital buys 37 apartments in Mumbai’s Worli for over Rs 500 crore
news.para: Etonhurst Capital Partners has made a significant investment in Mumbai's luxury real estate. The platform acquired 37 ready-to-move-in apartments in Worli for over Rs 500 crore. This deal marks the first inventory buyout by an institutional investor in the luxury housing market. Etonhurst plans to refurbish the apartments before putting them up for sale.

news.title: Persistent glitches mar Maharashtra’s deemed conveyance portal, send people back to govt offices
news.para: Maharashtra's Pratyay MahaBhumi portal, intended to streamline deemed conveyance for housing societies, is plagued with technical issues, forcing applicants back to traditional methods. Despite its promise to digitize the entire process and eliminate in-person visits, many societies are unable to log in or proceed with their applications.

news.title: Haryana RERA orders builder to refund cash payment, refers case to I-T department
news.para: Rera Haryana is cracking down on black money in real estate, referring cases with cash transactions above Rs 2 lakh to the Income Tax Department. In a recent case, a Panipat buyer received a refund of Rs 10 lakh, plus interest, after paying cash for a flat.

news.title: Karnataka RERA holds builders, landowners equally liable for civic amenities
news.para: The order, issued on July 30 by a K-RERA bench comprising Chairman Rakesh Singh and Member J R Reddy, came while hearing a complaint by 30 residents, including L. Arun, against Adi Developers.

news.title: China Evergrande to be delisted from Hong Kong stock exchange following debt woes
news.para: China Evergrande, facing liquidation, will be delisted from Hong Kong's stock exchange on August 25. Trading halted after a court order due to debt issues. The company failed to provide a restructuring plan. This fuels concerns about China's property sector. Other developers also face liquidation. Founder Hui Ka Yan was detained. The firm and executives faced penalties.

news.title: CapitaLand to invest over ₹19,200 crore by 2030 to expand in Mumbai & Pune
news.para: CapitaLand Investment (CLI) plans a significant investment in Maharashtra. The real estate giant will invest over ₹19,200 crore in Mumbai and Pune by 2030. CLI aims to boost its funds under management considerably. Investments will span business parks, data centers, and logistics facilities. This expansion builds on CLI's existing presence in the region.

news.title: Sebi bans DHFL's Kapil Wadhawan, Dheeraj Wadhawan, four more from securities market
news.para: Sebi has penalized six individuals, including former DHFL CMD Kapil Wadhawan and ex-director Dheeraj Wadhawan, for financial irregularities. They are barred from the securities market for up to five years and fined Rs 120 crore. DHFL diverted funds to 'Bandra Book Entities' linked to promoters, misrepresenting loans as retail housing loans and inflating profits, misleading investors.

news.title: Berger Paints aiming for ₹20,000 crore turnover by 2030: CEO
news.para: Berger Paints India aims for a Rs 20,000 crore turnover by 2030, driven by growth in decorative paints, construction chemicals, and industrial segments. Despite economic challenges, the company achieved over seven per cent volume growth and improved profitability. Berger focuses on innovation, digitalization, and network expansion while holding a 20 per cent market share.

news.title: Over 13 lakh houses sanctioned for poor in last three years: Uttar Pradesh minister
news.para: Uttar Pradesh has sanctioned over 13 lakh houses for the poor and underprivileged in the last three years, as stated by Rural Development Minister Vijay Laxmi Gautam in the state Assembly. Under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, 10,44,876 houses were sanctioned, while 2,62,594 houses were approved under the Mukhyamantri Awas Yojana between 2022-23 and 2024-25. A survey covering 57.

news.title: Brigade Hotel Ventures posts profit of ₹7 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Brigade Hotel Ventures Limited announced a consolidated net profit of Rupees 7.16 crore for the first quarter. This follows a net loss in the same period last year. Total income increased to Rupees 125.03 crore. The company plans to open nine new hotels using IPO funds and internal cash flow.

news.title: Shriram Properties' net profit rises 17.93% Q1 FY26
news.para: Shriram Properties announced a 17.93% rise in net consolidated profit, reaching ₹20.59 crore in Q1 FY26, alongside a 24.01% increase in total income to ₹261.54 crore. The company achieved sales of 0.8 million sq ft, valued at ₹441 crore, marking a 17% year-on-year growth.

news.title: Nila Spaces invests ₹5 crore in Earth Fund
news.para: Nila Spaces has invested ₹5 crore in Earth Fund, gaining priority access to innovative ventures in smart infrastructure and digital construction. This strategic move allows Nila Spaces to integrate cutting-edge solutions into its projects. The investment platform supports startups focused on PropTech and climate-friendly real estate advancements.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body to issue SOP for ready mix concrete plants soon
news.para: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) is set to release a new standard operating procedure (SOP) for ready mix concrete (RMC) plants, mandating registration and authorization before construction. This action follows AUDA's SOP release in April 2025.

news.title: Karnataka cracks down on illegal layouts, officials face action
news.para: Investigations have revealed that in several instances, officials colluded with landowners to bypass conversion norms, allowing large-scale violations. Revenue Department targets misuse of 11E maps, vowing land seizures, disciplinary measures, and weekly progress checks to curb rampant violations.

news.title: Property owners slam Bengaluru’s civic officials for issuing penalties but not updating e-khata
news.para: BBMP's move to penalize e-khata holders for under-declared parking space, while refusing to update property dimensions even after penalty payment, has sparked outrage among Bengaluru property owners. Residents fear this discrepancy will create disputes within apartment complexes regarding maintenance charges and parking slot ownership.

news.title: Tamil Nadu plans special purpose vehicle for co-working space project
news.para: Chennai is planning more co-working spaces. The state government will create a special purpose vehicle. This SPV will manage these spaces independently. It will ensure smooth functioning. The CMDA plans to host recruitment agencies in these spaces. This will help members find jobs. A portal with job data will also be created. The placement system will be free.
